title: If you say "ez" after a game I'm reporting you
body:
I don't care if it's a joke.

I don't care if you lost horribly and you're being facetious. 

It's poor sportsmanship so I'm reporting you for negative attitude, and I encourage you all to do the same.

Now isn't that so much nicer of a way to say what you were trying to get through rather than raging and screaming about reporting people?

Seriously, Saw a lilypichu video, she was asked to give any tips and that was her tip, to turn all chat off, and its been a game changer for me.

I don't care if it is meant as a joke, if you won and say GG EZ, you're a douch, that's not fun it's just of plain taste and I will probably report you. (losing and saying it is another story entirely)
Do I expect a ban? No.
Do I think, if that guy is being a douch other time hopefully he will get a CR? Of course I do.

That's the kind of thing to say in games that makes you look like a douch, at least if you want to belittle someone do it with pride and go for something original, I don't know like: "It was a fun walk in the park guys GG had fun." seems a lot more funny/less annoying.

If you lost horribly and you say Ez, then that is not worthy of a report because it is SO obviously a joke that only a dumbass like you would ever report anyone who says it in that context. Like, what an idiot.

There are such things as rude and dis respectful jokes. If your mother had died from a car crash, and I made the joke "well she was a woman duh" (as in a joke against female driving skills), I'm sure you'd take offense to that, despite it being a "joke", and if you don't, then you seem to be a heartless prick anyway and anything you say is now null and void.
um...what relation do those two VASTLY different situations have? None. Not even the "punch line"......what a fail

Did you just try to relate someone saying EZ in a video game to someones mother dieing in a car crash?¿?¿

***My brain just blue screened***
I always find it funny that the one who say it most are those who win games against a team that is down at least one player

I assure you, I have much worse things to say than that.

I've been perma-banned eight going on nine times for infamous lines such as "ha", "foo", ":D", or "lasers OP" (I play {{champion:161}}).

Occasionally I just stop caring and go all out and say "ya got whooped".  This usually leads to me getting banned so badly that I have to make two new accounts to get past the perma-ban. 

It's too fun and I'll never learn.

My last game with vi I would telegraph my ganks to the enemy cait. Telling her I was coming for that booty. After ganking her 4 times she stopped saying 'come get it' that's the kind of fun interesting banter that I expect from all chat.
Yeah, I'm gonna go ahead and bet that those statements had nothing significant to do with any permabans you may have received.
I don't say anything in this game anymore. People report for everything and I'm not giving them the satisfaction of reporting me so they feel cool.

You're playing a video game, not participating in the Olympics. Reporting absolutely everyone who says a specific phrase like that, regardless of context, is just absurd. I say shit like that all the time when I lose ("close game" comes to mind). It's just a joke, and usually it's very clear that it's a joke since I chat a lot in-game and I at least hope I don't come across as the type of jackass who would genuinely mean it.

If you get some try-hard asshole who flames his teammates and trash-talks the enemy the entire game, and in post-game chat he says "ez," then go ahead. Report 'em. If it's someone who's just being facetious, then fuck off and get a sense of humor.

It amazes me that you have the nerve to call people immature for reporting you when you immaturely say "gg ez" after you win.

Act like a child, get tattled on like a child.

I don't think I completely understand the logic behind taking this negatively. They almost definitely mean nothing mean spirited or negative by it, and if they do then they likely have done something worse that that to warrant a report. And personally, I find it entertaining in certain situations. This entire thread is silly to me.

In some essence, I can see "gg ez" as being a rather distasteful form of bad sportsmanship from either team (win or loss).
I don't necessarily think it warrants a report (as I've said earlier, but I got down-voted there for stating that) compared to other forms of negative attitude. And you're right, if they are being negative, chances are that they would have said something else they could get reported for.

I'd never solely report someone for "gg ez" unless they've been outlandishly rude all game, and a poor sport (again, win or loss).

I already do report these people. But between this and all the actual horrible things people say, I'm beginning to realize it's pointless. There is no punishment for these people. Riot doesn't care how disgusting the behavior is.
